isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9100 DAY CAB MODELS)

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9100 DAY CAB MODELS)

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 82. 9100 Day Cab Model Cab Air Suspension

svcprocinfo.para: The cab air suspension system for the 9100 day cab model contains one air spring (bag) (Item 7), two shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 10). The air suspension assembly needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air line (Item 16), fittings (Items 14 and 15), air spring (Item 7), height control valve (Item 10), shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) and lateral control rod (Item 6) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve, air spring (bag) and shock absorbers are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para: Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and connections. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of components.

svcsubproc.title: Height Control Valve - Remove

note.para: If there is an attempt to disas- semble or adjust fittings on the height control valve ( Item 10, Figure 82), it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 79 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove air line (Item 1) from push-in connector (Item 7). Remove compression nut (Item 8) and remove air line (Item 2) from the height control valve (Item 3).
Disconnect the height control valve linkage (Item 4) from the height control valve arm (Item 5).
Remove height control valve ( Item 10, Figure 82) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts ( Items 18 and 19, Figure 82) securing the height control valve to the mounting bracket.
Position the height control valve in place on the mounting bracket and secure it with hex bolts and hex lock nuts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).
Connect the height control valve linkage to the height control valve arm.

Connect the air supply line to the height control valve with the push-in connector. Then connect the air line with compression nut to the height control valve. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab height between the bottom of the cab mounting bracket and the top of the crossmember mounting bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is 5-3/16 inches ( Figure 80). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9100 DAY CAB MODELS).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove shock absorber (Item 8) from between the cab mounting bracket (Item 1) and crossmember mounting bracket (Item 2) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 21 and 24) at the top, and hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 22 and 24) at the bottom of the shock absorber.

Remove shock absorber (Item 9), shock washer and shock spacer limiter (Items 4 and 5) from between the cab mounting bracket (Item 1) and crossmember mounting bracket (Item 2) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 21 and 24) at the top, and hex lock nut (Item 27) and shock washer (Item 4) at the bottom of the shock absorber.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Install

step1.para: Position shock absorber with shock washer and shock spacer limiter into mounting hole in crossmember mounting bracket. Ensure that top shock tabs rest above holes in cab mounting bracket.
Install hex bolts and hex lock nuts at the top, and hex lock nut with shock washer at the bottom of the shock absorber. Tighten to 45 ft-lbs. (61 Nm).
Position shock absorber with bottom shock tabs below the holes in the crossmember mounting bracket. Ensure that top shock tabs rest above holes in cab mounting bracket.
Install hex bolts and hex lock nuts at the top, and hex bolts and hex lock nuts at the bottom of the shock absorber. Tighten to 45 ft-lbs. (61 Nm).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Remove

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove compression nut and air line (Item 16) from the elbow fitting (Item 15) at the air spring (bag) (Item 7).
Remove the elbow and nipple fittings (Items 15 and 14) from the top of the air spring (bag) (Item 7).
Remove the hex bolt (Item 25) at the cab mounting bracket (Item 1), then remove the machine screw (Item 26) under the crossmember mounting bracket (Item 2).
Slide the air spring (bag) (Item 7) from between the cab mounting bracket (Item 1) and crossmember mounting bracket (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag) - Install

step1.para: Place the air spring (bag) in position between the cab mounting bracket and crossmember mounting bracket.

Position the air spring (bag) in place and install machine screw from underneath the crossmember mounting bracket, then install hex bolt into the cab mounting bracket at the top of the air spring (bag). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of mounting hardware.
Install the elbow and nipple fittings into the top of the air spring (bag). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Install compression nut and air line into elbow fitting at the top of air spring (bag). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab height between the bottom of cab mounting bracket and the top of the crossmember mounting bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is 5-3/16 inches ( Figure 80). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR SUSPENSION (9100 DAY CAB MODELS).
